alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 8:29AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A snow squall will affect Rock island...Northwestern Whiteside... Northwestern Henry...Eastern Jo daviess...Carroll...Stephenson... Southeastern Jackson...Scott...Eastern Muscatine and Clinton counties through 915 AM CST... At 828 AM CST, a snow squall was located along a line extending from Waddams Grove to Illinois City. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Visibilities less than a quarter of a mile and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar and observations. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Bettendorf, Clinton, Freeport, Muscatine, East Moline, Durant, Mount Carroll, Silvis, Eldridge, DeWitt, Milan, Colona, Camanche, Le Claire, Coal Valley, Fulton and Savanna. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 280 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A rapid drop in temperatures will lead to the rapid formation of black ice on area roadways. Black ice is nearly impossible to see and roadways may appear wet. Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.
